description: Convert audio to text with neural network models.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key from Google Console

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Api secret from Google Console

args.name: code
args.info: Code provided by client

args.name: redirectUrl
args.info: Redirect URL (your app url)

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token from getAccessToken method

args.name: file
args.info: Audio file to recognition

args.name: encoding
args.info: Encoding type: LINEAR16, FLAC, MULAW, AMR, AMR_WB

args.name: rate
args.info: Sample rate in Hertz of the audio data sent. Valid values are: 8000-48000

args.name: languageCode
args.info: The language of the supplied audio as a BCP-47 language tag. Example: 'en-GB'

args.name: maxAlternatives
args.info: Maximum number of recognition hypotheses to be returned. Valid values are 0-30. A value of 0 or 1 will return a maximum of 1. If omitted, defaults to 1.

args.name: profanityFilter
args.info: If set to true, the server will attempt to filter out profanities, replacing all but the initial character in each filtered word with asterisks, e.g. 'f***'. If set to false or omitted, profanities won't be filtered out.

args.name: phrases
args.info: Comma-separated phrases. A means to provide context to assist the speech recognition.
